chapterSummary.General: God continues His demonstration of power through two more devastating plagues: locusts that consume all remaining vegetation and a darkness so thick it can be felt. These plagues further demonstrate God's complete control over nature and His supremacy over Egyptian gods.
chapterSummary.Non-Denominational: Focuses on God's continued demonstration of power through devastating plagues, showing His supremacy over false gods.
chapterSummary.Baptist: Emphasizes God's sovereign power in judging Egypt's gods and demonstrating His authority over creation.
chapterSummary.Catholic: Highlights God's demonstration of power through devastating plagues, showing His supremacy over Egyptian deities and His care for His people.
chapterSummary.Methodist: Focuses on God's judgment of Egyptian oppression and His demonstration of power through nature.
chapterSummary.Lutheran: Emphasizes God's supremacy over Egyptian gods and His demonstration of power through creation.
chapterSummary.Presbyterian: Stresses God's covenantal faithfulness in judging Egypt and demonstrating His authority.
chapterSummary.Pentecostal: Highlights God's supernatural power in judging Egypt's gods and demonstrating His authority.
chapterSummary.Anglican: Emphasizes God's demonstration of power through devastating plagues, showing His supremacy over Egyptian deities.
chapterSummary.Orthodox: Focuses on God's supremacy over Egyptian gods through successive plagues and His care for His people.

1.General: The divine command to confront evil, demonstrating God's authority and power

1.Catholic: The Lord's instruction to face opposition, showing His power and the call to faithful witness
1.Methodist: The divine command to confront evil, demonstrating God's authority and His call to justice

1.Presbyterian: The divine command to confront evil, demonstrating God's authority and His covenantal faithfulness
1.Pentecostal: The Lord's instruction to face opposition, showing His power and His empowerment of His servants
1.Anglican: The divine command to confront evil, demonstrating God's authority and His call to faithful witness
1.Orthodox: The Lord's instruction to face opposition, showing His power and His care for His people
